task:
Attached is an AnnData object. Using the grouping column `adata.obs['time']` (levels: {Sham, 4h, 12h, 2d, 14d, 6w}), compute the fraction of target cells (`FR-PT`) per group and determine whether the fraction has increased by the comparison group (`14d`). Return EXACTLY in the following format:
<EVAL_ANSWER>
{
  "per_group": [
    {"group": "Sham", "count_target": 0, "count_all": 0, "percent": 0.0},
    {"group": "4h",   "count_target": 0, "count_all": 0, "percent": 0.0},
    {"group": "12h",  "count_target": 0, "count_all": 0, "percent": 0.0},
    {"group": "2d",   "count_target": 0, "count_all": 0, "percent": 0.0},
    {"group": "14d",  "count_target": 0, "count_all": 0, "percent": 0.0},
    {"group": "6w",   "count_target": 0, "count_all": 0, "percent": 0.0}
  ],
  "increases_by_compare_group": true,
  "delta_vs_baseline_pct": 0.0
}
</EVAL_ANSWER>
Notes:
- Define targets with `predicted_cell_type == 'FR-PT'`.
- percent = 100 * count_target / count_all for each group.
- If a group is missing in the data, include it with zeros so all listed levels appear in order: [Sham, 4h, 12h, 2d, 14d, 6w].

scoring.description: Pass if FR-PT fraction at 14d is significantly higher than baseline (Fisher exact, one-sided, Î±=0.05).
